Dialogue.TextLine: Hello, I am Sahasrahla. This is a demonstration of a Zelda style dialogue system. Press Space to continue to the next part of dialogue.
Here you will see the power of this dialogue box.
Well, it's not perfect. But if it will be enough for your basic dialogue box needs.
You can press X to display the text faster. I will talk a lot next time so you can try.

I will now also use a function to play a music file!
Pretty neat huh?
I will now also use a function to stop the music.
All the dialogues must be written in a single XML file and only a few events are needed.
You just need to write some functions, if you want to do something at the beginning of a new speech line, or when the text is entirely displayed.
A new feature has just been added. You can now insert variable names in your dialogues and it will replace it with it's value.
Let's make an example.
Click a few time on this rupee and when you're done, click on done.
You've clicked that rupee...exactly {clicks} times.
I couldn't know that before you clicked, haha.
Oh, what's this?
Do you know this deku scrub?
That's what I thought. You two look pretty intimate if you know what I mean.
Oh really? She seems to know you though.
By the way, you just saw that it's possible to do choices.
We're having a lot of fun, aren't we?
SHUT UP HYLIANS!!!
I'M GONNA KILL YOU ALL!!!
Oh my god! I think it's time to end the demonstration.
I have to go now, I hope it will be useful to you. Leave a comment if you want some improvements.
Bye!
